result.execSummary:
The defendant Askia Alie Strong was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property (Not Exceeding $2,500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes:
Court ordered DNA sample to be taken and DNA surcharge to be paid.
Pay all applicable Court costs, fees and DNA surcharge by March 15, 2017 or a civil judgment to be entered.
Concurrent with: Concurrent with any other sentence.  Huber privileges pursuant to 303.08 Wis. stats to work only.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Askia Alie Strong

records.addlTxt:
Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant. 
The Court ordered defendant to serve 20 days in the House of Correction, concurrent to any other sentence, with credit for 0 days time served, the Court grants Huber privileges, pursuant to 303.08 Wis. Stats. for work ONLY.

Court ordered defendant to pay all applicable court costs and fees by March 15, 2017, or a civil judgment be entered.

Court ordered DNA sample to be taken and DNA surcharge to be paid by March 15, 2017.

Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief; received and filed.

Defendant Askia Alie Strong in court with attorney Colin P. McGinn.  Defendant Askia Alie Strong in custody.  Joy Hammond appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant changes plea to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights. Plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the criminal complaint and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.

Defendant Askia Alie Strong in court with attorney Colin P. McGinn.  Joy Hammond appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  The defendant is in custody in Waukesha County.  Court waives the appearance of the defendant for this hearing.  Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea in Branch 21.  All parties are notified that effective March 14, 2016 this case will be assigned to Judge Michael Hanrahan - Branch 4 in Room 622 - Courthouse.  Stipulated request for adjournment received and filed.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for March 16, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Askia Alie Strong not in court and is in custody in Waukesha County.  Taylor L. Kraus appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  vk  A public defender has not been appointed by the SPD office.  Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department to place a detainer on the defendant.   Court ordered case adjourned for status conference in Branch 21.  Status conference scheduled for February 25, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
State public defenders office is notified of the next court date via email by the clerk.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Cecily K., and Clean Power, 124 N 121st St., Wauwatosa.  Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.  DEFENDANT WAS ORDERED BY THE COURT TO REPORT TO THE MILWAUKEE COUNTY JAIL (CJF) TO BE BOOKED AND RELEASED BY 3:00 P.M. ON  2/4/16. IF THEY FAIL TO APPEAR A BENCH WARRANT WILL BE ISSUED FOR THEIR ARREST.

Defendant Askia Alie Strong in court.  Bruce J. Landgraf appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  OCCR Tape#16-022
Defendant advised that this case is assigned to Reserve Judge, Branch 21.
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel and maximum penalties.  Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance.  Defendant IS Public Defender eligible.  Defendant is ordered to provide the public defender's office with the next court date.  The case is adjourned to Br. 21 for a Pretrial Conference. Defendant taken into custody by Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department on an unrelated matter.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for February 9, 2016 at 08:30 am.
Summons mailed.  Defendant is Out-of-Custody. Court appearance in Out-Of-Custody Court, Room 221 Safety Building on 2-3-16 at 1:30pm
